title: On the Local Finite Density Relativistic Quantum Field Theories
abstract: It is found that, in addition to the conventional ones, a local approach to the relativistic quantum field theories at both zero and finite density consistent with the violation of Bell like inequalities should contain, and provide solutions to at least three additional problems, namely, 1) the statistical gauge invariance 2) the dark components of the local observables and 3) the fermion statistical block effects, base upon an asymptotic non-thermo ensemble. An application to models are presented to show the relevance of the discussions.
